description: Borrowed from German Gauleiter, from Gau (“administrative division”) + Leiter (“leader”).

entries.meaning: (historical) An official in charge of a district of Nazi Germany.
Any overbearing or unpleasant official, especially a local official.
examples: Five minutes later, Martland and his gauleiters canter in and whisk poor Hockbottle off to the Cottage Hospital of evil fame.
